newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 26.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 26.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
* Australia and New Zealand Banking Group A$8.315 (+0.135)

The Commonwealth Bank of Australia denied collusion among the big banks in their decision not to pass on all of Friday's 0.5 point rate cut. The banks have come under pressure from Prime Minister JOhn Howard to pass on the full rate cut, while the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission is to investigate the "limited and uniform reduction" in rates.

Qantas Airways chief executive James Strong said he expected the airline to exceed its cost-cut target for the year to June 30, 1997, last estimated by the company at A$430 million. Aviation analysts expect Qantas to save about A$500 million in spending during the 1996/97 financial year.

National Mutual is tipped to report a small rise in half-year net profit on Tuesday, reflecting better investment returns and lower costs. Insurance analysts expect the French controlled insurer to report a net profit of between A$116 million and A$153 million for the six months ended March 31.
* The Broken Hill Pty Co A$19.32 (+0.12)
BHP confirmed up to 500 jobs may be cut from the San Manuel division of its Arizona-based Magma Copper Co unit as part of its effort to increase productivity in its copper business.

The gold explorer said on Friday it had no information which could explain recent trading in its stock. Shares in the company, which is closely-watched by traders and investors for its exploration drilling programme in the Gawler Craton region of South Australia, rose 12.5 cents on Friday but are still well off their 12-month high of A$4.99.
